headline.main: Petrobras Says Project Financing Unaffected by S&P Downgrade
headline.print_headline: Petrobras Says Project Financing Unaffected by S&P Downgrade

docs.snippet: Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA said on Thursday that its financing is sufficient to fund projects in the medium term, despite the downgrade of the company's credit rating by Standard & Poor's....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA said on Thursday that its financing is sufficient to fund projects in the medium term, despite the downgrade of the company's credit rating by Standard & Poor's.

headline.main: Florida Jury Awards $17 Million to Abused Migrant Female Farm Workers
headline.print_headline: Florida Jury Awards $17 Million to Abused Migrant Female Farm Workers

docs.snippet: A federal jury awarded almost $17.5 million to five former female employees of a South Florida farm who said they were  either raped and sexually harassed at a vegetable packing plant, their lawyer and the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commiss...
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal jury awarded almost $17.5 million to five former female employees of a South Florida farm who said they were  either raped and sexually harassed at a vegetable packing plant, their lawyer and the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) said on Thursday.

headline.main: New U.S. Prosecution Policy Is Recipe for Corporate Conflict: Lawyers
headline.print_headline: New U.S. Prosecution Policy Is Recipe for Corporate Conflict: Lawyers

docs.snippet: Company executives may be quicker to hire lawyers and less likely to cooperate with investigations because of a renewed push by U.S. prosecutors to put individuals in prison instead of only levying big fines on corporations that break the law, law...
docs.lead_paragraph: Company executives may be quicker to hire lawyers and less likely to cooperate with investigations because of a renewed push by U.S. prosecutors to put individuals in prison instead of only levying big fines on corporations that break the law, lawyers with expertise in white-collar crime cases said.

headline.main: Sheriff: Lawmaker Cited for Making Out 'Changed Her Tune'
headline.print_headline: Sheriff: Lawmaker Cited for Making Out 'Changed Her Tune'

docs.snippet: A Minnesota lawmaker cited for making out in a public park with a fellow legislator "changed her tune" between the date of the incident and when details started to trickle out, according to an email from the sheriff whose office handled the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Minnesota lawmaker cited for making out in a public park with a fellow legislator "changed her tune" between the date of the incident and when details started to trickle out, according to an email from the sheriff whose office handled the case.

headline.main: Djokovic, Federer Face Tough Tests to Making Finals
headline.print_headline: Djokovic, Federer Face Tough Tests to Making Finals

docs.snippet: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer remain on course for a marquee one-two clash in the men's U.S. Open final, but each must first vanquish a formidable opponent and friend in Friday's semi-finals at Flushing Meadows....
docs.lead_paragraph: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer remain on course for a marquee one-two clash in the men's U.S. Open final, but each must first vanquish a formidable opponent and friend in Friday's semi-finals at Flushing Meadows.

headline.main: Emotional Biden Says Not 'There' When Asked About Presidential Run
headline.print_headline: Emotional Biden Says Not 'There' When Asked About Presidential Run

docs.snippet: U.S. Vice President Joe Biden, in an emotional interview with comedian Stephen Colbert on Thursday, said he was not in a place to say he could devote his full self to running for president again....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Vice President Joe Biden, in an emotional interview with comedian Stephen Colbert on Thursday, said he was not in a place to say he could devote his full self to running for president again.

headline.main: Man Charged in Plot to Bomb 9/11 Memorial
headline.print_headline: Man Charged in Plot to Bomb 9/11 Memorial

docs.snippet: A Florida man faces up to 20 years in federal prison after authorities say he was trying to help plan an attack on an upcoming 9/11 memorial in Missouri....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida man faces up to 20 years in federal prison after authorities say he was trying to help plan an attack on an upcoming 9/11 memorial in Missouri.

headline.main: ATF Investigates Fire That Destroyed Famous South Dakota Bar
headline.print_headline: ATF Investigates Fire That Destroyed Famous South Dakota Bar

docs.snippet: Federal authorities began investigating Thursday the cause of a fire that destroyed a popular South Dakota biker bar, but they cautioned their presence didn't necessarily indicate any criminal wrongdoing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities began investigating Thursday the cause of a fire that destroyed a popular South Dakota biker bar, but they cautioned their presence didn't necessarily indicate any criminal wrongdoing.

headline.main: Exclusive: DraftKings, FanDuel Both Ready Their Next Wall Street Playbooks
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: DraftKings, FanDuel Both Ready Their Next Wall Street Playbooks

docs.snippet: FanDuel and DraftKings, the two leading fantasy sports companies in North America, are both planning their next big financial moves – including whether to raise more money privately or do initial public offerings. DraftKings says it would ev...
docs.lead_paragraph: FanDuel and DraftKings, the two leading fantasy sports companies in North America, are both planning their next big financial moves – including whether to raise more money privately or do initial public offerings. DraftKings says it would even consider merging with FanDuel.
